column4: i have installed apache2 using the apt-get install apache 2 command but it is not working.. when i type localhost in the firefox it's says that cannot establish connection.. so i try to install apache and it worked :S some one please help me!!!! i want to install apache 2 not apache
apache2 is one word
i don't understand u:S
apt-get install apache2, not apache 2
yes i know and i've installed it but it's not working.. apache works only apache2 not:S
apache is not available in ubuntu
u dont uderstand me.. apache is working on my com. but apache2 not :S why??
did you start it, and/or see if it's listening? use ps -aux |grep apa   to see if it's started, and netstat -tanp to see if anything is listening
how did you install apache1? it hasn't been avail for over a year iirc
i just type sudo apt-get install apache
what distro are you running? it's not in the ubuntu repositories, i'm wondering if you installed it from elsewhere?
no i installed it using that command..
i am woundering why apache works.. but apache 2 not:S
uninstall apache, it's not a valid server these days, nor is it supported
ok thnx.. some good server for joomla?:)
do you know what version of ubuntu you are running?
yes i know 7.04
ok, we're all on 7.10, that might make a difference
ok thnx for the time!
but use apache2 as the package name to install
i solve the problem apache2 is not compatible with ubuntu 7.04
why do you think apache2 isn't compatible with 7.04?
